description:
It’s such a mystery to me how anyone can leave the house with a phone but not a power bank. You never know when you’ll be caught out for longer than expected, or you might have forgotten to charge up, and end up with a dead phone in your pocket. There’s no excuse, especially when you can get the ultra-compact Baseus PicoGo for just $18 right now. That’s an astonishing 55% off, available now via Woot!

The Baseus PicoGo power bank is so tiny, it fits in the palm of your hand. It has a decent 10,000mAh capacity—enough to recharge most phones about two times over—and it has a 45W output that’ll get your device juiced up in under an hour. It’s also decent enough for accessories like earbuds, but not that great for laptops. Win some, lose some.

My favorite th
title: Wow! This ultra-compact power bank with built-in USB-C cable is 55% off

description:
At some point over the past few years, we entered the mini PC era. These tiny machines strike an excellent balance between price and performance, making them a better choice over laptops for many people. And right now, you can save big on this GMKtec NucBox K6 mini PC with a 29% discount on Amazon, bringing its price down to $455.98 (was $639.99). That matches its lowest-ever price!

The specs on this machine beat any laptop you’ll find in its price range: an AMD Ryzen 7 7840HS processor, a chunky 32GB of speedy DDR5 memory, and a spacious 1TB SSD that’ll hold all your data and load it in a flash. That’s a powerful config that’ll gracefully handle Windows 11 plus all your apps and browser tabs without slowing to a crawl.

It’s also powerful enough to support triple 4K@60Hz monitors, thank
title: This speedy Ryzen 7 mini PC with 32GB DDR5 RAM is 29% off right now
